00002 // File: DXUTMisc.h

00013 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00014 // A growable array
00015 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00016 template< typename TYPE >
00017 class CGrowableArray
00018 {
00019 public:
00020     CGrowableArray()  { m_pData = NULL; m_nSize = 0; m_nMaxSize = 0; }
00021     CGrowableArray( const CGrowableArray<TYPE>& a ) { for( int i=0; i < a.m_nSize; i++ ) Add( a.m_pData[i] ); }
00022     ~CGrowableArray() { RemoveAll(); }
00023 
00024     const TYPE& operator[]( int nIndex ) const { return GetAt( nIndex ); }
00025     TYPE& operator[]( int nIndex ) { return GetAt( nIndex ); }
00026    
00027     CGrowableArray& operator=( const CGrowableArray<TYPE>& a ) { if( this == &a ) return *this; RemoveAll(); for( int i=0; i < a.m_nSize; i++ ) Add( a.m_pData[i] ); return *this; }
00028 
00029     HRESULT SetSize( int nNewMaxSize );
00030     HRESULT Add( const TYPE& value );
00031     HRESULT Insert( int nIndex, const TYPE& value );
00032     HRESULT SetAt( int nIndex, const TYPE& value );
00033     TYPE&   GetAt( int nIndex ) { assert( nIndex >= 0 && nIndex < m_nSize ); return m_pData[nIndex]; }
00034     int     GetSize() const { return m_nSize; }
00035     TYPE*   GetData() { return m_pData; }
00036     bool    Contains( const TYPE& value ){ return ( -1 != IndexOf( value ) ); }
00037 
00038     int     IndexOf( const TYPE& value ) { return ( m_nSize > 0 ) ? IndexOf( value, 0, m_nSize ) : -1; }
00039     int     IndexOf( const TYPE& value, int iStart ) { return IndexOf( value, iStart, m_nSize - iStart ); }
00040     int     IndexOf( const TYPE& value, int nIndex, int nNumElements );
00041 
00042     int     LastIndexOf( const TYPE& value ) { return ( m_nSize > 0 ) ? LastIndexOf( value, m_nSize-1, m_nSize ) : -1; }
00043     int     LastIndexOf( const TYPE& value, int nIndex ) { return LastIndexOf( value, nIndex, nIndex+1 ); }
00044     int     LastIndexOf( const TYPE& value, int nIndex, int nNumElements );
00045 
00046     HRESULT Remove( int nIndex );
00047     void    RemoveAll() { SetSize(0); }
00048 
00049 protected:
00050     TYPE* m_pData;      // the actual array of data
00051     int m_nSize;        // # of elements (upperBound - 1)
00052     int m_nMaxSize;     // max allocated
00053 
00054     HRESULT SetSizeInternal( int nNewMaxSize );  // This version doesn't call ctor or dtor.
00055 };
00056

00058 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00059 // Performs timer operations
00060 // Use DXUTGetGlobalTimer() to get the global instance
00061 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00062 class CDXUTTimer
00063 {
00064 public:
00065     CDXUTTimer();
00066 
00067     void Reset(); // resets the timer
00068     void Start(); // starts the timer
00069     void Stop();  // stop (or pause) the timer
00070     void Advance(); // advance the timer by 0.1 seconds
00071     double GetAbsoluteTime(); // get the absolute system time
00072     double GetTime(); // get the current time
00073     double GetElapsedTime(); // get the time that elapsed between GetElapsedTime() calls
00074     bool IsStopped(); // returns true if timer stopped
00075 
00076 protected:
00077     bool m_bUsingQPF;
00078     bool m_bTimerStopped;
00079     LONGLONG m_llQPFTicksPerSec;
00080 
00081     LONGLONG m_llStopTime;
00082     LONGLONG m_llLastElapsedTime;
00083     LONGLONG m_llBaseTime;
00084 };
00085 
00086 CDXUTTimer* DXUTGetGlobalTimer();

00094 enum DXUTCACHE_SOURCELOCATION { DXUTCACHE_LOCATION_FILE, DXUTCACHE_LOCATION_RESOURCE };
00095 
00096 struct DXUTCache_Texture
00097 {
00098     DXUTCACHE_SOURCELOCATION Location;
00099     WCHAR wszSource[MAX_PATH];
00100     HMODULE hSrcModule;
00101     UINT Width;
00102     UINT Height;
00103     UINT Depth;
00104     UINT MipLevels;
00105     DWORD Usage;
00106     D3DFORMAT Format;
00107     D3DPOOL Pool;
00108     D3DRESOURCETYPE Type;
00109     IDirect3DBaseTexture9 *pTexture;
00110 };

00113 {
00114     ID3DXFont *pFont;
00115 };
00116

00118 {

00121     HMODULE hSrcModule;
00122     DWORD dwFlags;
00123     ID3DXEffect *pEffect;
00124 };

00171 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00172 class CD3DArcBall
00173 {
00174 public:
00175     CD3DArcBall();
00176 
00177     // Functions to change behavior
00178     void Reset(); 
00179     void SetTranslationRadius( FLOAT fRadiusTranslation ) { m_fRadiusTranslation = fRadiusTranslation; }
00180     void SetWindow( INT nWidth, INT nHeight, FLOAT fRadius = 0.9f ) { m_nWidth = nWidth; m_nHeight = nHeight; m_fRadius = fRadius; m_vCenter = D3DXVECTOR2(m_nWidth/2.0f,m_nHeight/2.0f); }
00181     void SetOffset( INT nX, INT nY ) { m_Offset.x = nX; m_Offset.y = nY; }
00182 
00183     // Call these from client and use GetRotationMatrix() to read new rotation matrix
00184     void OnBegin( int nX, int nY );  // start the rotation (pass current mouse position)
00185     void OnMove( int nX, int nY );   // continue the rotation (pass current mouse position)
00186     void OnEnd();                    // end the rotation 
00187 
00188     // Or call this to automatically handle left, middle, right buttons
00189     LRESULT     HandleMessages( HWND hWnd, UINT uMsg, WPARAM wParam, LPARAM lParam );
00190 
00191     // Functions to get/set state
00192     const D3DXMATRIX* GetRotationMatrix()                   { return D3DXMatrixRotationQuaternion(&m_mRotation, &m_qNow); };
00193     const D3DXMATRIX* GetTranslationMatrix() const          { return &m_mTranslation; }
00194     const D3DXMATRIX* GetTranslationDeltaMatrix() const     { return &m_mTranslationDelta; }
00195     bool        IsBeingDragged() const                      { return m_bDrag; }
00196     D3DXQUATERNION GetQuatNow() const                       { return m_qNow; }
00197     void        SetQuatNow( D3DXQUATERNION q ) { m_qNow = q; }
00198 
00199     static D3DXQUATERNION QuatFromBallPoints( const D3DXVECTOR3 &vFrom, const D3DXVECTOR3 &vTo );
00200 
00201 
00202 protected:
00203     D3DXMATRIXA16  m_mRotation;         // Matrix for arc ball's orientation
00204     D3DXMATRIXA16  m_mTranslation;      // Matrix for arc ball's position
00205     D3DXMATRIXA16  m_mTranslationDelta; // Matrix for arc ball's position
00206 
00207     POINT          m_Offset;   // window offset, or upper-left corner of window
00208     INT            m_nWidth;   // arc ball's window width
00209     INT            m_nHeight;  // arc ball's window height
00210     D3DXVECTOR2    m_vCenter;  // center of arc ball 
00211     FLOAT          m_fRadius;  // arc ball's radius in screen coords
00212     FLOAT          m_fRadiusTranslation; // arc ball's radius for translating the target
00213 
00214     D3DXQUATERNION m_qDown;             // Quaternion before button down
00215     D3DXQUATERNION m_qNow;              // Composite quaternion for current drag
00216     bool           m_bDrag;             // Whether user is dragging arc ball
00217 
00218     POINT          m_ptLastMouse;      // position of last mouse point
00219     D3DXVECTOR3    m_vDownPt;           // starting point of rotation arc
00220     D3DXVECTOR3    m_vCurrentPt;        // current point of rotation arc
00221 
00222     D3DXVECTOR3    ScreenToVector( float fScreenPtX, float fScreenPtY );
00223 };

00226 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00227 // used by CCamera to map WM_KEYDOWN keys
00228 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00229 enum D3DUtil_CameraKeys
00230 {
00231     CAM_STRAFE_LEFT = 0,
00232     CAM_STRAFE_RIGHT,
00233     CAM_MOVE_FORWARD,
00234     CAM_MOVE_BACKWARD,
00235     CAM_MOVE_UP,
00236     CAM_MOVE_DOWN,
00237     CAM_RESET,
00238     CAM_CONTROLDOWN,
00239     CAM_MAX_KEYS,
00240     CAM_UNKNOWN = 0xFF
00241 };
00242 
00243 #define KEY_WAS_DOWN_MASK 0x80
00244 #define KEY_IS_DOWN_MASK  0x01
00245 
00246 #define MOUSE_LEFT_BUTTON   0x01
00247 #define MOUSE_MIDDLE_BUTTON 0x02
00248 #define MOUSE_RIGHT_BUTTON  0x04
00249 #define MOUSE_WHEEL         0x08
00250

00252 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00253 // Simple base camera class that moves and rotates.  The base class
00254 //       records mouse and keyboard input for use by a derived class, and 
00255 //       keeps common state.
00256 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00257 class CBaseCamera
00258 {
00259 public:
00260     CBaseCamera();
00261 
00262     // Call these from client and use Get*Matrix() to read new matrices
00263     virtual LRESULT HandleMessages( HWND hWnd, UINT uMsg, WPARAM wParam, LPARAM lParam );
00264     virtual void    FrameMove( FLOAT fElapsedTime ) = 0;
00265 
00266     // Functions to change camera matrices
00267     virtual void Reset(); 
00268     virtual void SetViewParams( D3DXVECTOR3* pvEyePt, D3DXVECTOR3* pvLookatPt );
00269     virtual void SetProjParams( FLOAT fFOV, FLOAT fAspect, FLOAT fNearPlane, FLOAT fFarPlane );
00270 
00271     // Functions to change behavior
00272     virtual void SetDragRect( RECT &rc ) { m_rcDrag = rc; }
00273     void SetInvertPitch( bool bInvertPitch ) { m_bInvertPitch = bInvertPitch; }
00274     void SetDrag( bool bMovementDrag, FLOAT fTotalDragTimeToZero = 0.25f ) { m_bMovementDrag = bMovementDrag; m_fTotalDragTimeToZero = fTotalDragTimeToZero; }
00275     void SetEnableYAxisMovement( bool bEnableYAxisMovement ) { m_bEnableYAxisMovement = bEnableYAxisMovement; }
00276     void SetEnablePositionMovement( bool bEnablePositionMovement ) { m_bEnablePositionMovement = bEnablePositionMovement; }
00277     void SetClipToBoundary( bool bClipToBoundary, D3DXVECTOR3* pvMinBoundary, D3DXVECTOR3* pvMaxBoundary ) { m_bClipToBoundary = bClipToBoundary; if( pvMinBoundary ) m_vMinBoundary = *pvMinBoundary; if( pvMaxBoundary ) m_vMaxBoundary = *pvMaxBoundary; }
00278     void SetScalers( FLOAT fRotationScaler = 0.01f, FLOAT fMoveScaler = 5.0f )  { m_fRotationScaler = fRotationScaler; m_fMoveScaler = fMoveScaler; }
00279     void SetNumberOfFramesToSmoothMouseData( int nFrames ) { if( nFrames > 0 ) m_fFramesToSmoothMouseData = (float)nFrames; }
00280     void SetResetCursorAfterMove( bool bResetCursorAfterMove ) { m_bResetCursorAfterMove = bResetCursorAfterMove; }
00281 
00282     // Functions to get state
00283     const D3DXMATRIX*  GetViewMatrix() const { return &m_mView; }
00284     const D3DXMATRIX*  GetProjMatrix() const { return &m_mProj; }
00285     const D3DXVECTOR3* GetEyePt() const      { return &m_vEye; }
00286     const D3DXVECTOR3* GetLookAtPt() const   { return &m_vLookAt; }
00287     float GetNearClip() const { return m_fNearPlane; }
00288     float GetFarClip() const { return m_fFarPlane; }
00289 
00290 
00291     bool IsBeingDragged() const         { return (m_bMouseLButtonDown || m_bMouseMButtonDown || m_bMouseRButtonDown); }
00292     bool IsMouseLButtonDown() const     { return m_bMouseLButtonDown; } 
00293     bool IsMouseMButtonDown() const     { return m_bMouseMButtonDown; } 
00294     bool IsMouseRButtonDown() const     { return m_bMouseRButtonDown; } 
00295 
00296 protected:
00297     // Functions to map a WM_KEYDOWN key to a D3DUtil_CameraKeys enum
00298     virtual D3DUtil_CameraKeys MapKey( UINT nKey );    
00299     bool IsKeyDown( BYTE key ) const { return( (key & KEY_IS_DOWN_MASK) == KEY_IS_DOWN_MASK ); }
00300     bool WasKeyDown( BYTE key ) const { return( (key & KEY_WAS_DOWN_MASK) == KEY_WAS_DOWN_MASK ); }
00301 
00302     void ConstrainToBoundary( D3DXVECTOR3* pV );
00303     void UpdateMouseDelta( float fElapsedTime );
00304     void UpdateVelocity( float fElapsedTime );
00305 
00306     D3DXMATRIX            m_mView;              // View matrix 
00307     D3DXMATRIX            m_mProj;              // Projection matrix
00308 
00309     int                   m_cKeysDown;            // Number of camera keys that are down.
00310     BYTE                  m_aKeys[CAM_MAX_KEYS];  // State of input - KEY_WAS_DOWN_MASK|KEY_IS_DOWN_MASK
00311     POINT                 m_ptLastMousePosition;  // Last absolute position of mouse cursor
00312     bool                  m_bMouseLButtonDown;    // True if left button is down 
00313     bool                  m_bMouseMButtonDown;    // True if middle button is down 
00314     bool                  m_bMouseRButtonDown;    // True if right button is down 
00315     int                   m_nCurrentButtonMask;   // mask of which buttons are down
00316     int                   m_nMouseWheelDelta;     // Amount of middle wheel scroll (+/-) 
00317     D3DXVECTOR2           m_vMouseDelta;          // Mouse relative delta smoothed over a few frames
00318     float                 m_fFramesToSmoothMouseData; // Number of frames to smooth mouse data over
00319 
00320     D3DXVECTOR3           m_vDefaultEye;          // Default camera eye position
00321     D3DXVECTOR3           m_vDefaultLookAt;       // Default LookAt position
00322     D3DXVECTOR3           m_vEye;                 // Camera eye position
00323     D3DXVECTOR3           m_vLookAt;              // LookAt position
00324     float                 m_fCameraYawAngle;      // Yaw angle of camera
00325     float                 m_fCameraPitchAngle;    // Pitch angle of camera
00326 
00327     RECT                  m_rcDrag;               // Rectangle within which a drag can be initiated.
00328     D3DXVECTOR3           m_vVelocity;            // Velocity of camera
00329     bool                  m_bMovementDrag;        // If true, then camera movement will slow to a stop otherwise movement is instant
00330     D3DXVECTOR3           m_vVelocityDrag;        // Velocity drag force
00331     FLOAT                 m_fDragTimer;           // Countdown timer to apply drag
00332     FLOAT                 m_fTotalDragTimeToZero; // Time it takes for velocity to go from full to 0
00333     D3DXVECTOR2           m_vRotVelocity;         // Velocity of camera
00334 
00335     float                 m_fFOV;                 // Field of view
00336     float                 m_fAspect;              // Aspect ratio
00337     float                 m_fNearPlane;           // Near plane
00338     float                 m_fFarPlane;            // Far plane
00339 
00340     float                 m_fRotationScaler;      // Scaler for rotation
00341     float                 m_fMoveScaler;          // Scaler for movement
00342 
00343     bool                  m_bInvertPitch;         // Invert the pitch axis
00344     bool                  m_bEnablePositionMovement; // If true, then the user can translate the camera/model 
00345     bool                  m_bEnableYAxisMovement; // If true, then camera can move in the y-axis
00346 
00347     bool                  m_bClipToBoundary;      // If true, then the camera will be clipped to the boundary
00348     D3DXVECTOR3           m_vMinBoundary;         // Min point in clip boundary
00349     D3DXVECTOR3           m_vMaxBoundary;         // Max point in clip boundary
00350 
00351     bool                  m_bResetCursorAfterMove;// If true, the class will reset the cursor position so that the cursor always has space to move 
00352 };
00353 
00354 
00355 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00356 // Simple first person camera class that moves and rotates.
00357 //       It allows yaw and pitch but not roll.  It uses WM_KEYDOWN and 
00358 //       GetCursorPos() to respond to keyboard and mouse input and updates the 
00359 //       view matrix based on input.  
00360 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00361 class CFirstPersonCamera : public CBaseCamera
00362 {
00363 public:
00364     CFirstPersonCamera();
00365 
00366     // Call these from client and use Get*Matrix() to read new matrices
00367     virtual void FrameMove( FLOAT fElapsedTime );
00368 
00369     // Functions to change behavior
00370     void SetRotateButtons( bool bLeft, bool bMiddle, bool bRight, bool bRotateWithoutButtonDown = false );
00371 
00372     // Functions to get state
00373     D3DXMATRIX*  GetWorldMatrix()            { return &m_mCameraWorld; }
00374 
00375     const D3DXVECTOR3* GetWorldRight() const { return (D3DXVECTOR3*)&m_mCameraWorld._11; } 
00376     const D3DXVECTOR3* GetWorldUp() const    { return (D3DXVECTOR3*)&m_mCameraWorld._21; }
00377     const D3DXVECTOR3* GetWorldAhead() const { return (D3DXVECTOR3*)&m_mCameraWorld._31; }
00378     const D3DXVECTOR3* GetEyePt() const      { return (D3DXVECTOR3*)&m_mCameraWorld._41; }
00379 
00380 protected:
00381     D3DXMATRIX m_mCameraWorld;       // World matrix of the camera (inverse of the view matrix)
00382 
00383     int        m_nActiveButtonMask;  // Mask to determine which button to enable for rotation
00384         bool       m_bRotateWithoutButtonDown;
00385 };
00386 
00387 
00388 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00389 // Simple model viewing camera class that rotates around the object.
00390 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00391 class CModelViewerCamera : public CBaseCamera
00392 {
00393 public:
00394     CModelViewerCamera();
00395 
00396     // Call these from client and use Get*Matrix() to read new matrices
00397     virtual LRESULT HandleMessages( HWND hWnd, UINT uMsg, WPARAM wParam, LPARAM lParam );
00398     virtual void FrameMove( FLOAT fElapsedTime );
00399 
00400    
00401     // Functions to change behavior
00402     virtual void SetDragRect( RECT &rc );
00403     void Reset(); 
00404     void SetViewParams( D3DXVECTOR3* pvEyePt, D3DXVECTOR3* pvLookatPt );
00405     void SetButtonMasks( int nRotateModelButtonMask = MOUSE_LEFT_BUTTON, int nZoomButtonMask = MOUSE_WHEEL, int nRotateCameraButtonMask = MOUSE_RIGHT_BUTTON ) { m_nRotateModelButtonMask = nRotateModelButtonMask, m_nZoomButtonMask = nZoomButtonMask; m_nRotateCameraButtonMask = nRotateCameraButtonMask; }
00406     void SetAttachCameraToModel( bool bEnable = false ) { m_bAttachCameraToModel = bEnable; }
00407     void SetWindow( int nWidth, int nHeight, float fArcballRadius=0.9f ) { m_WorldArcBall.SetWindow( nWidth, nHeight, fArcballRadius ); m_ViewArcBall.SetWindow( nWidth, nHeight, fArcballRadius ); }
00408     void SetRadius( float fDefaultRadius=5.0f, float fMinRadius=1.0f, float fMaxRadius=FLT_MAX  ) { m_fDefaultRadius = m_fRadius = fDefaultRadius; m_fMinRadius = fMinRadius; m_fMaxRadius = fMaxRadius; }
00409     void SetModelCenter( D3DXVECTOR3 vModelCenter ) { m_vModelCenter = vModelCenter; }
00410     void SetLimitPitch( bool bLimitPitch ) { m_bLimitPitch = bLimitPitch; }
00411     void SetViewQuat( D3DXQUATERNION q ) { m_ViewArcBall.SetQuatNow( q ); m_bDragSinceLastUpdate = true; }
00412     void SetWorldQuat( D3DXQUATERNION q ) { m_WorldArcBall.SetQuatNow( q ); m_bDragSinceLastUpdate = true; }
00413 
00414     // Functions to get state
00415     const D3DXMATRIX* GetWorldMatrix() const { return &m_mWorld; }
00416     void SetWorldMatrix( D3DXMATRIX &mWorld ) { m_mWorld = mWorld; m_bDragSinceLastUpdate = true; }
00417 
00418 protected:

00595 // These macros are very similar to dxerr9's but it special cases the HRESULT defined
00596 // by DXUT to pop better message boxes. 
00597 #if defined(DEBUG) | defined(_DEBUG)
00598 #define DXUT_ERR(str,hr)           DXUTTrace( __FILE__, (DWORD)__LINE__, hr, str, false )
00599 #define DXUT_ERR_MSGBOX(str,hr)    DXUTTrace( __FILE__, (DWORD)__LINE__, hr, str, true )
00600 #define DXUTTRACE                  DXUTOutputDebugString
00601 #else
00602 #define DXUT_ERR(str,hr)           (hr)
00603 #define DXUT_ERR_MSGBOX(str,hr)    (hr)
00604 #define DXUTTRACE                  (__noop)
00605 #endif

00612

00614 int WINAPI DXUT_Dynamic_D3DPERF_BeginEvent( D3DCOLOR col, LPCWSTR wszName );

00622 
00623 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00624 // Profiling/instrumentation support
00625 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00626 
00627 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00628 // Some D3DPERF APIs take a color that can be used when displaying user events in 
00629 // performance analysis tools.  The following constants are provided for your 
00630 // convenience, but you can use any colors you like.
00631 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00632 const D3DCOLOR DXUT_PERFEVENTCOLOR  = D3DCOLOR_XRGB(200,100,100);
00633 const D3DCOLOR DXUT_PERFEVENTCOLOR2 = D3DCOLOR_XRGB(100,200,100);
00634 const D3DCOLOR DXUT_PERFEVENTCOLOR3 = D3DCOLOR_XRGB(100,100,200);
00635 
00636 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00637 // The following macros provide a convenient way for your code to call the D3DPERF 
00638 // functions only when PROFILE is defined.  If PROFILE is not defined (as for the final 
00639 // release version of a program), these macros evaluate to nothing, so no detailed event
00640 // information is embedded in your shipping program.  It is recommended that you create
00641 // and use three build configurations for your projects:
00642 //     Debug (nonoptimized code, asserts active, PROFILE defined to assist debugging)
00643 //     Profile (optimized code, asserts disabled, PROFILE defined to assist optimization)
00644 //     Release (optimized code, asserts disabled, PROFILE not defined)
00645 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00646 #ifdef PROFILE
00647 // PROFILE is defined, so these macros call the D3DPERF functions
00648 #define DXUT_BeginPerfEvent( color, pstrMessage )   DXUT_Dynamic_D3DPERF_BeginEvent( color, pstrMessage )
00649 #define DXUT_EndPerfEvent()                         DXUT_Dynamic_D3DPERF_EndEvent()
00650 #define DXUT_SetPerfMarker( color, pstrMessage )    DXUT_Dynamic_D3DPERF_SetMarker( color, pstrMessage )
00651 #else
00652 // PROFILE is not defined, so these macros do nothing
00653 #define DXUT_BeginPerfEvent( color, pstrMessage )   (__noop)
00654 #define DXUT_EndPerfEvent()                         (__noop)
00655 #define DXUT_SetPerfMarker( color, pstrMessage )    (__noop)
00656 #endif
00657 
00658 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00659 // CDXUTPerfEventGenerator is a helper class that makes it easy to attach begin and end
00660 // events to a block of code.  Simply define a CDXUTPerfEventGenerator variable anywhere 
00661 // in a block of code, and the class's constructor will call DXUT_BeginPerfEvent when 
00662 // the block of code begins, and the class's destructor will call DXUT_EndPerfEvent when 
00663 // the block ends.
00664 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00665 class CDXUTPerfEventGenerator
00666 {
00667 public:
00668     CDXUTPerfEventGenerator( D3DCOLOR color, LPCWSTR pstrMessage ) { DXUT_BeginPerfEvent( color, pstrMessage ); }
00669     ~CDXUTPerfEventGenerator( void ) { DXUT_EndPerfEvent(); }
00670 };
00671 
00672 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00673 // Implementation of CGrowableArray
00674 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00675 
00676 // This version doesn't call ctor or dtor.
00677 template< typename TYPE >
00678 HRESULT CGrowableArray<TYPE>::SetSizeInternal( int nNewMaxSize )
00679 {
00680     if( nNewMaxSize < 0 )
00681     {
00682         assert( false );
00683         return E_INVALIDARG;
00684     }
00685 
00686     if( nNewMaxSize == 0 )
00687     {
00688         // Shrink to 0 size & cleanup
00689         if( m_pData )
00690         {
00691             free( m_pData );
00692             m_pData = NULL;
00693         }
00694 
00695         m_nMaxSize = 0;
00696         m_nSize = 0;
00697     }
00698     else if( m_pData == NULL || nNewMaxSize > m_nMaxSize )
00699     {
00700         // Grow array
00701         int nGrowBy = ( m_nMaxSize == 0 ) ? 16 : m_nMaxSize;
00702         nNewMaxSize = __max( nNewMaxSize, m_nMaxSize + nGrowBy );
00703 
00704         TYPE* pDataNew = (TYPE*) realloc( m_pData, nNewMaxSize * sizeof(TYPE) );
00705         if( pDataNew == NULL )
00706             return E_OUTOFMEMORY;
00707 
00708         m_pData = pDataNew;
00709         m_nMaxSize = nNewMaxSize;
00710     }
00711 
00712     return S_OK;
00713 }
00714 
00715 
00716 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00717 template< typename TYPE >
00718 HRESULT CGrowableArray<TYPE>::SetSize( int nNewMaxSize )
00719 {
00720     int nOldSize = m_nSize;
00721 
00722     if( nOldSize > nNewMaxSize )
00723     {
00724         // Removing elements. Call dtor.
00725 
00726         for( int i = nNewMaxSize; i < nOldSize; ++i )
00727             m_pData[i].~TYPE();
00728     }
00729 
00730     // Adjust buffer.  Note that there's no need to check for error
00731     // since if it happens, nOldSize == nNewMaxSize will be true.)
00732     HRESULT hr = SetSizeInternal( nNewMaxSize );
00733 
00734     if( nOldSize < nNewMaxSize )
00735     {
00736         // Adding elements. Call ctor.
00737 
00738         for( int i = nOldSize; i < nNewMaxSize; ++i )
00739             ::new (&m_pData[i]) TYPE;
00740     }
00741 
00742     return hr;
00743 }
00744 
00745 
00746 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00747 template< typename TYPE >
00748 HRESULT CGrowableArray<TYPE>::Add( const TYPE& value )
00749 {
00750     HRESULT hr;
00751     if( FAILED( hr = SetSizeInternal( m_nSize + 1 ) ) )
00752         return hr;
00753 
00754     // Construct the new element
00755     ::new (&m_pData[m_nSize]) TYPE;
00756 
00757     // Assign
00758     m_pData[m_nSize] = value;
00759     ++m_nSize;
00760 
00761     return S_OK;
00762 }
00763 
00764 
00765 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00766 template< typename TYPE >
00767 HRESULT CGrowableArray<TYPE>::Insert( int nIndex, const TYPE& value )
00768 {
00769     HRESULT hr;
00770 
00771     // Validate index
00772     if( nIndex < 0 || 
00773         nIndex > m_nSize )
00774     {
00775         assert( false );
00776         return E_INVALIDARG;
00777     }
00778 
00779     // Prepare the buffer
00780     if( FAILED( hr = SetSizeInternal( m_nSize + 1 ) ) )
00781         return hr;
00782 
00783     // Shift the array
00784     MoveMemory( &m_pData[nIndex+1], &m_pData[nIndex], sizeof(TYPE) * (m_nSize - nIndex) );
00785 
00786     // Construct the new element
00787     ::new (&m_pData[nIndex]) TYPE;
00788 
00789     // Set the value and increase the size
00790     m_pData[nIndex] = value;
00791     ++m_nSize;
00792 
00793     return S_OK;
00794 }
00795 
00796 
00797 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00798 template< typename TYPE >
00799 HRESULT CGrowableArray<TYPE>::SetAt( int nIndex, const TYPE& value )
00800 {
00801     // Validate arguments
00802     if( nIndex < 0 ||
00803         nIndex >= m_nSize )
00804     {
00805         assert( false );
00806         return E_INVALIDARG;
00807     }
00808 
00809     m_pData[nIndex] = value;
00810     return S_OK;
00811 }
00812 
00813 
00814 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00815 // Searches for the specified value and returns the index of the first occurrence
00816 // within the section of the data array that extends from iStart and contains the 
00817 // specified number of elements. Returns -1 if value is not found within the given 
00818 // section.
00819 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00820 template< typename TYPE >
00821 int CGrowableArray<TYPE>::IndexOf( const TYPE& value, int iStart, int nNumElements )
00822 {
00823     // Validate arguments
00824     if( iStart < 0 || 
00825         iStart >= m_nSize ||
00826         nNumElements < 0 ||
00827         iStart + nNumElements > m_nSize )
00828     {
00829         assert( false );
00830         return -1;
00831     }
00832 
00833     // Search
00834     for( int i = iStart; i < (iStart + nNumElements); i++ )
00835     {
00836         if( value == m_pData[i] )
00837             return i;
00838     }
00839 
00840     // Not found
00841     return -1;
00842 }
00843 
00844 
00845 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00846 // Searches for the specified value and returns the index of the last occurrence
00847 // within the section of the data array that contains the specified number of elements
00848 // and ends at iEnd. Returns -1 if value is not found within the given section.
00849 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00850 template< typename TYPE >
00851 int CGrowableArray<TYPE>::LastIndexOf( const TYPE& value, int iEnd, int nNumElements )
00852 {
00853     // Validate arguments
00854     if( iEnd < 0 || 
00855         iEnd >= m_nSize ||
00856         nNumElements < 0 ||
00857         iEnd - nNumElements < 0 )
00858     {
00859         assert( false );
00860         return -1;
00861     }
00862 
00863     // Search
00864     for( int i = iEnd; i > (iEnd - nNumElements); i-- )
00865     {
00866         if( value == m_pData[i] )
00867             return i;
00868     }
00869 
00870     // Not found
00871     return -1;
00872 }
00873 
00874 
00875 
00876 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00877 template< typename TYPE >
00878 HRESULT CGrowableArray<TYPE>::Remove( int nIndex )
00879 {
00880     if( nIndex < 0 || 
00881         nIndex >= m_nSize )
00882     {
00883         assert( false );
00884         return E_INVALIDARG;
00885     }
00886 
00887     // Destruct the element to be removed
00888     m_pData[nIndex].~TYPE();
00889 
00890     // Compact the array and decrease the size
00891     MoveMemory( &m_pData[nIndex], &m_pData[nIndex+1], sizeof(TYPE) * (m_nSize - (nIndex+1)) );
00892     --m_nSize;
00893 
00894     return S_OK;
00895 }
00896 
00897 
00898 #endif
